com.microsoft.azure.sdk.iot.device.transport

Interface IotHubTransport

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AmqpsTransport, HttpsTransport, MqttTransport

    public interface IotHubTransport
extends java.io.Closeable
    An interface for an IoT Hub transport.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addMessage(Message message, IotHubEventCallback callback, java.lang.Object callbackContext)
      Adds a message to the transport queue.
      void addMessage(Message message, IotHubResponseCallback callback, java.lang.Object callbackContext)
      Adds a message to the transport queue.
      void close()
      Closes all resources used to communicate with an IoT Hub.
      void handleMessage()
      Invokes the message callback if a message is found and responds to the IoT Hub on how the processed message should be handled by the IoT Hub.
      void invokeCallbacks()
      Invokes the callbacks for all completed requests.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if the transport has no more messages to handle, and false otherwise.
      void multiplexOpen(java.util.List<DeviceClient> deviceClientList)
      Establishes a communication channel usingmultiplexing with an IoT Hub.
      void open()
      Establishes a communication channel with an IoT Hub.
      void registerConnectionStateCallback(IotHubConnectionStateCallback callback, java.lang.Object callbackContext)
      Registers a callback to be executed whenever the connection to the IoT Hub is lost or established.
      void sendMessages()
      Sends all messages on the transport queue.

    • Method Detail

      • open

        void open()
   throws java.io.IOException
        Establishes a communication channel with an IoT Hub. If a channel is already open, the function shall do nothing.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a communication channel cannot be established.

      • multiplexOpen

        void multiplexOpen(java.util.List<DeviceClient> deviceClientList)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Establishes a communication channel usingmultiplexing with an IoT Hub. If a channel is already open, the function shall do nothing.
        Parameters:
        deviceClientList - the list of clients use the same transport.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a communication channel cannot be established.

      • close

        void close()
    throws java.io.IOException
        Closes all resources used to communicate with an IoT Hub. Once close() is called, the transport is no longer usable. If the transport is already closed, the function shall do nothing.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs in closing the transport.

      • addMessage

        void addMessage(Message message,
                IotHubEventCallback callback,
                java.lang.Object callbackContext)
        Adds a message to the transport queue.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be sent.
        callback - the callback to be invoked when a response for the message is received.
        callbackContext - the context to be passed in when the callback is invoked.

      • addMessage

        void addMessage(Message message,
                IotHubResponseCallback callback,
                java.lang.Object callbackContext)
        Adds a message to the transport queue.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be sent.
        callback - the callback to be invoked when a response for the message is received.
        callbackContext - the context to be passed in when the callback is invoked.

      • sendMessages

        void sendMessages()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Sends all messages on the transport queue. If a previous send attempt had failed, the function will attempt to resend the messages in the previous attempt.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the server could not be reached.

      • invokeCallbacks

        void invokeCallbacks()
        Invokes the callbacks for all completed requests.

      • handleMessage

        void handleMessage()
            throws java.io.IOException

        Invokes the message callback if a message is found and responds to the IoT Hub on how the processed message should be handled by the IoT Hub.

        If no message callback is set, the function will do nothing.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the server could not be reached.

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if the transport has no more messages to handle, and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the transport has no more messages to handle, and false otherwise.

      • registerConnectionStateCallback

        void registerConnectionStateCallback(IotHubConnectionStateCallback callback,
                                     java.lang.Object callbackContext)
        Registers a callback to be executed whenever the connection to the IoT Hub is lost or established.
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback to be called.
        callbackContext - a context to be passed to the callback. Can be null if no callback is provided.
